title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.36 | 25-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 36th verse of the 11th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
This is the section which describes Krishna's relationship with his queens
And Suta Goswami clarifies a very very important point in this connection
The verse is as follows
The meaning of this verse is
Although the queen's beautiful smiles and furtive glances were all spotless and exciting
And although they could conquer Cupid himself by making him give up his bow in frustration
And although even the tolerant Shiva could fall victim to them
Still, despite all their magical feats and attractions
They could not agitate the senses of the Lord
Now, Suta Goswami is describing the transcendental quality of the soul
Of the Supreme Lord in his association with his 16,108 queens
What is the spiritual nature of the Lord?
He is un-agitated by their association
Even though they are very very beautiful
They have beautiful smiles
They have very very attractive glances
They can conquer Cupid himself
Cupid generally agitates the mind of materialistic people in this world
To get attracted to material beauty
But Cupid himself becomes attracted by the beauty of these queens
And the Lord Shiva is known as a Dheera
But even Lord Shiva
He may fall victim to the attraction of the queens
But the queens can never agitate the senses of the Supreme Lord
Which means that
Why did Upanishad interact with the queens
as if he was engaged in a mundane love affair?
That is because of the 곰
Deer
their devotion that we explained in the later verse so here it is just stated by
Suta Goswami that they could not agitate the senses of the Lord so Srila
Prabhupada explains in the purport the path of salvation that means the path of
liberation from this material bondage are a path going back to Godhead always
forbids the association of women and a complete Sanatana Dharma or Vanashrama
Dharma scheme forbids or restricts association of women Srila Prabhupada
explains elsewhere three of the four ashramas completely forbid association
with women brahmachari ashram vanaprastha ashram and sannyas ashram no
association of women only in the Gita
Grihastha ashrama there is permission to associate with women that also under
highly restricted conditions only with one wife and that also for the sake of
producing Krishna conscious children and becoming responsible raising
children and becoming responsible raising children and becoming responsible raising
a Krishna conscious family all these are there
Grihastha ashrama Grihastha Dharma Grihastha Dharma so Prabhupada raises
this question how then can one be accepted of the Supreme Personality of
Godhead who is addicted to more than 16,000 wives Krishna seemed to be very
much attached to those Queens
and He is one person and He has 16,108 Queens and is attached to them so what is
the proper understanding this question may relevantly be raised by inquisitive
persons really anxious to know about the transcendental nature of the Supreme
Lord. And to answer such questions, the sages at Nainbi Sharanya have discussed the transcendental
character of the Lord in this and in the following verses. What is that transcendental nature of
Krishna different from the nature of people of this world? How is it different? So Srila Prabhupada
further says, it is clear herein that the feminine attractive features which can conquer Cupid or
even the supermost tolerant Lord Shiva could not conquer the senses of the Lord. Here is
the difference, the distinct difference between Krishna and everyone else. Cupid's business is
to invoke mundane lust. Mundane lust means his material lust. Material lust means materially
attractive, material lust means material lust. Material lust means material lust means material
lust. Material lust means material lust. Material lust means material lust. Material lust means
material lust means material lust. Flute 아주 is the spirit with which the want of банal
lust in spiritual earth is manifested. Extract love and karmically flow in the
world instead of the lust. Tambad iramthis great 스�ırहामि revenues from the
the activities of the world are being carried on by the central attraction of male and female
that is the central point of material existence a male is searching after a mate to his liking
and the female is looking after a suitable male that is the way of material stimulus and as soon
as a male is combined with a female the material bondage of the living being is
at once tightly interlocked by sex relation and as a result of this both the males and
females attraction for sweet home motherland bodily offspring wealth becomes the illusory
field of activities a whole field of activities opens up
man and woman marriage
each other and then the family expands children and relation and relatives and
friends and and home and and wealth and accumulation of wealth a society
friendship community all these things become the illusory field of activities
and thus a false but indefatigable attraction for a temporary material
existence which is full of miseries is manifest see material existence means
miseries under illusion we cannot understand that we always think
miseries are now and then coming and going that's what we think but actually
we are always
in the middle of miseries sometimes these miseries are overlooked we are not
cognizant of them or it doesn't bother us as much as it may bother somebody
else just like the climatic conditions are related for some people a cold
weather is very much related to the situation of the world.
some Ontarians say that the cold weather is pleasant for the people who are in the
cold weather and they dislike the cold weather because the body, the body is
pleasant for them because their body somehow they have made it acclimatized to
the cold weather by generating lot of heat within and they like this cold
weather but in summer they just can't tolerate even a little bit of heat they cannot tolerate and then the other people are not tolerant of them so that's a concept.
whose body is very warm they are not so uncomfortable in summer but in winter
they can't tolerate little cold also. The fact is this is told by one Acharya
Govinda Das Kaviraj. We are always harassed by four
different material conditions, climatic conditions. Sheetha means cold, Vata.
Sheetha-Atapa means heat and Vata means wind and varisolana-the rain.
Cold, heat, wind and rain these are sometimes
there in different
times of the year and they always bother us one or the other botheration is there
but we are so determined to enjoy that will somehow make adjustment and try to
live amid such conditions unfavorable conditions and try to create a
favorable atmosphere by adjustment this called material advancement of
civilization but the scriptures warn us and awaken us to the reality it is
temporary and you are simply engaged in a hard struggle for existence so those
who are therefore on the path of salvation for going back home back to
Godhead are especially advised by all scriptural instructions to become free
from the bondage of the world and become free from the bondage of the world and
from such paraphernalia of material attraction because material attraction
makes us forget the reality we go deeper into illusion beacuse of material
attraction between male and female and how is this possible to become free from
this paraphernalia of material attraction it is possible only by
association of the devotees of the Lord were called Mahatmas...Mahar Manas Tummampartha Day目
The Mahatmas are the pure devotees, they are always under the shelter of the internal potency
of the Lord, the spiritual potency and they are always engaged in devotional service and
such Mahatmas association will help us to become free from material attraction.
Now Prabhupada explains elaborately that this material world is such that Cupid's work is
going on to keep the living entities under material bondage.
But association of devotees helps us to come out of this material bondage by losing attraction
for all material things, by developing spiritual attraction to come out of this bondage.
Krishna, it is not done in a void.
It is possible by positive spiritual attraction.
And that positive spiritual attraction is by association of pure devotees, association
of pure devotees.
So it is described here, just like the Lord is transcendentally situated because of which
he is never agitated.
He is never agitated by any feminine attractive features.
Similarly, if we situate ourselves on the spiritual platform, all material attraction
will be nullified, attractions will be nullified completely.
And we get attracted to Krishna, which is desirable, which is most desirable, which
is the best.
The safest and the topmost position of perfection for any living being to get attracted to Krishna
and to become attached to Krishna, to become connected with Krishna in eternal relationship
of love.
That is the goal.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
